}} '''Balangir''' is a city and [[Nagar Palika|municipality]], the headquarters of [[Balangir district]] in the state of [[Odisha]], India. Balangir has a rich cultural heritage. It is also known as the cultural hub of Western Odisha.<ref name="test">[http://www.mapsofindia.org/orissa/balangir.html Balangir is a famous city in Odisha and also the major hub of trade and commerce of Odisha]</ref><ref name="test1">{{Cite web |url=http://rtiodisha.gov.in/Department/Culture-Department/33/District-Culture-Office-Bolangir/2723/About-the-Organization/2 |title=has been designed as a District Culture Centre |access-date=17 January 2013 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130730121839/http://rtiodisha.gov.in/Department/Culture-Department/33/District-Culture-Office-Bolangir/2723/About-the-Organization/2 |archive-date=30 July 2013 |url-status=dead }}</ref> Balangir municipality is divided into twenty one wards. It is spread over an area of {{cvt|12,200|acre}}.<ref>http://ofbindia.gov.in/units/index.php?unit=ofbol&page=about&lang=en</ref><ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.ofbadmal.in/ |title=Archived copy |access-date=4 April 2013 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130403091707/http://www.ofbadmal.in/ |archive-date=3 April 2013 |url-status=dead }}</ref>
==Geography== Balangir is located at {{Coord|20.72|N|83.48|E|}}.<ref>[http://www.fallingrain.com/world/IN/21/Balangir.html Falling Rain Genomics, Inc - Balangir]</ref> It has an average elevation of 383 metres (800 feet) above [[sea level]].
==People from Balangir== *[[Srinibash Udgata]], Eminent Poet awarded [[Padma Shri]] by [[Government of India]] *[[Kailash Chandra Meher]], Eminent Artist awarded [[Padma Shri]] by [[Government of India]] *[[Narasingha Mishra]], Eminent Lawyer Twelfth Law Commission of [[Government Of India]] *[[Rasanara Parwin]] is a cricket player of [[India women's national cricket team]]. *[[Sam Pitroda]], telecom engineer, inventor, entrepreneur and policymaker.
==Transport== ===Air=== The [[Jharsuguda Airport]] at [[Jharsuguda]] is the nearest airport to the city while [[Swami Vivekananda Airport]] at [[Raipur]], [[Chhattisgarh]] is 234 km away. [[Biju Patnaik International Airport]] in the state capital, [[Bhubaneswar]] is 327 km away by road and 397 km by rail.
===Rail=== [[Balangir Railway Station]] on the [[Jharsuguda]]-[[Sambalpur]]-[[Titlagarh]] railway line of East Coast Railways is the city's railway link to the national railway network.
===Road=== Bolangir is connected by road to the state capital Bhubaneswar which is 327 km to the west.
==Politics== Current [[Member of the Legislative Assembly (India)|MLA]] from Bolangir Assembly Constituency is [[Narasingha Mishra]] of [[Indian National Congress]], who won the seat in State elections of 2014 by defeating [[Biju Janata Dal|BJD]] stalwart [[Ananga Udaya Singh Deo]].
Bolangir is part of [[Bolangir (Lok Sabha constituency)]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://archive.eci.gov.in/se2000/background/S18/Orissa_AC_Dist_PC.pdf |title=Assembly Constituencies - Corresponding Districts and Parliamentary Constituencies of Odisha |publisher=Election Commission of India |accessdate=2008-09-26 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20051108040424/http://archive.eci.gov.in/se2000/background/S18/Orissa_AC_Dist_PC.pdf |archivedate=2005-11-08 |df= }}</ref>
